intro: Ardisia morotaiensis, commonly known as Morotai beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the island of Morotai in Indonesia and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers followed by bright red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
